programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: From a brand new home, Rip Off Britain HQ in Salford, Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville are joined by Britain's best consumer experts to help solve the problems you send in every day. In this edition, we reveal customer service failures at one of the country's biggest energy firms, including the case of one woman whose account went from being £200 in credit to £6,000 in debt within days. We ask the new boss whether customer service is going to get better. Plus more frustration for customers of Britain's most complained about pay TV provider, and how one woman ended up with a £5,000 bill for a car accident that wasn't her fault - all because she unwittingly dialled the wrong number.

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds S1 (8/8)
programme.desc: Lifting the lid on the heart-rending, hard-headed decisions doctors must make.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars S2 (7/8)
programme.desc: It's the semi-final. Who will make it to the end?

programme.title: This is BBC Two
programme.desc: Highlights of programmes on BBC Two.

programme.title: Money for Nothing S14 (5/20)
programme.desc: Sarah Moore upcycles an Edwardian armchair, a display cabinet and some costume jewellery.

programme.title: Escape to the Country S23 (47/55)
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley helps a retired couple find a new home close to the Suffolk coast.

programme.title: A Special School S2 (2/3)
programme.desc: Dealing with thieves, puberty and love in Britain's biggest special education school.

programme.title: Caught Red Handed S11 (7/20)
programme.desc: A homeless musician's guitar is cruelly stolen by a mystery man.

programme.title: Nicky Campbell BBC News Talk
programme.desc: Nicky Campbell takes your calls on the day's talking points, hearing views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 between 9am and 11am on weekdays (calls are free from mobiles and landlines).

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: Twenty-four hours a day, the latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The big political issues of the day.

programme.title: Impossible S6
programme.desc: Game show presented by Rick Edwards in which players score points by answering questions correctly. However, they must avoid the impossible answers, otherwise they will be eliminated from the show until the next day. In each episode there are three rounds, and the three highest scorers from each round play against each other in the final. The winner of this battle faces a £10,000 question.

programme.title: Eggheads S20
programme.desc: Teams from all over the UK battle to beat the formidable Eggheads.

programme.title: James Martin's Food Map of Britain
programme.desc: Chef James Martin takes to the skies to explore how the beautiful and unique landscape of the British Isles produces distinct and delicious regional ingredients. He explores the fertile plains and lowlands of east Scotland to understand why Scottish whisky is not only considered the best in the world, but a true reflection of the landscape in which it is made. He also discovers why the raspberries grown near Strathmore are a class apart and such a sought-after ingredient. On his journey he prepares a whisky-cured salmon with beetroot dressing and blinis and a raspberry panna cotta with homemade mini doughnuts.

programme.title: A Countryside Summer S1 (4/15)
programme.desc: John Craven guides us through some top spots for birdwatching in the UK.

programme.title: Destination Wild : Japon (Hokkaido) (3/3)
programme.desc: «Hokkaido»A look at Hokkaido island, the country's northernmost point - a region that requires tough animals and tough people with ingenuity to thrive in an ever-changing environment.

programme.title: La face cachée d'Istanbul (Cairo) (n°1)
programme.desc: «Cairo»Michael Scott uses 3D scanning technology to reveal the secrets of Cairo and Ancient Egypt: from the Great Pyramid to a hidden Roman fortress to the Arabic citadel of Saladin.

programme.title: Flog It ! S14
programme.desc: Flog It! comes from Norwich Cathedral in Norfolk. In the great nave, experts Kate Bateman and David Fletcher pick out some choice items to take to auction. Among them are an enamel-topped silver trinket box and a vintage model car. Paul Martin uncovers the meaning of religious graffiti.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games S5
programme.desc: Every day this week, celebrity contestants Mehreen Baig, Clare Balding, Jamie Laing and Mike Wozniak take on a series of quiz rounds selected by the host, quiz legend Richard Osman. A daily winner is declared following a quickfire round at the end of each show, and the scores are tallied across the week, resulting in an overall champion being crowned on Friday. Will the winning stars opt for the much-coveted House of Games wheelie luggage, or will they be tempted by the House of Games reusable coffee mug, which is brand new for this series?

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys (Ulverston to Ravenglass) S2 (4/20)
programme.desc: «Ulverston to Ravenglass»Michael is in Cumbria, enjoying one of Britain's most spectacular coastal rail journeys.

programme.title: Brian Cox
programme.desc: The actor Brian Cox - star of the drama Succession - sits down with Amol Rajan to reveal the secrets of the show and what took him from poverty in Dundee all the way to Hollywood. The award-winning theatre, television and film actor reveals what really happens on set, his thoughts on the method acting technique used by one of his co-stars, and his best and worst moments since the show first aired in 2018.

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Lochs (The People's Lochs) S3 (4/6)
programme.desc: «The People's Lochs»Paul sets sail through the Kyles of Bute to Loch Long and the summit of the Cobbler.

programme.title: Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: Monty Don, Joe Swift and the team celebrate the passions behind the plants and gardens on show. Adam Frost uncovers the innovative design details hidden in the gardens, while Nick Bailey investigates how to future-proof planting choices ahead of a summer scorcher. Joe revels in the beauty of a houseplant favourite - the orchid - and Arit Anderson provides inspiration for gardens with the statement plants on display.

programme.title: Strike: Inside the Unions S1 (1/2)
programme.desc: State of the Unions.

programme.title: Inside No. 9 (The Last Weekend) S8 (6/6)
programme.desc: «The Last Weekend»Joe and Chas have been together for nine years. It's a long time to be truly in love with someone. But how long does it take to properly say goodbye?

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories. With Victoria Derbyshire.

programme.title: 11 Minutes: America's Deadliest Mass Shooting S1 (3/4)
programme.desc: Doctors concentrate resources on treating the wounded most likely to survive.

programme.title: 11 Minutes: America's Deadliest Mass Shooting S1 (4/4)
programme.desc: Many survivors still search for closure.
